sentences.english: Such bottlenecks have been hampering the opening of new mines and the expansion of existing ones.
sentences.chinese: 这些瓶颈已经妨碍新矿的开发和已有矿产的扩大。

sentences.english: Non-metallic mineral resources are very rich in Inner Mongolia, but development and utilization are very poor.
sentences.chinese: 我区非金属矿产资源丰富，但开发利用程度很低。

sentences.english: The project belongs to metallurgic mineral field.
sentences.chinese: 本项目属冶金矿产领域。

sentences.english: Authors will particularly introduce the MRAS application in mineral prediction.
sentences.chinese: 现对MRAS在矿产预测中的应用做详细的介绍。

sentences.english: But some of them are non-renewable such as coal and oil.
sentences.chinese: 但有些是不可再生的，像矿产和石油资源。

sentences.english: He says little of the income from oil, the mining and extractive sectors trickle down to the poor.
sentences.chinese: 他说，石油和矿产资源出口带来的收入很少惠及穷人。

sentences.english: The undulating hills are rich in mineral resources.
sentences.chinese: 峰峦起伏的群山中蕴藏着丰富的矿产资源。

sentences.chinese: 地质矿产资源是经济和社会可持续发展的保障。

sentences.english: Department of Geology and Mineral Resources of North China Petroleum Geological Exploration Bureau census …
sentences.chinese: 地质矿产部华北石油地质局第三普查勘探大队修配厂。

sentences.english: GIS-based Digital Mine (DM) is the key on the mineral resource prediction.
sentences.chinese: 而基于GIS的数字矿区是进行矿产资源预测的关键。

sentences.english: The geology and mineral resources contribute to safeguard sustainable development in economy and society.
sentences.chinese: 地质矿产资源是经济和社会可持续发展的保障。

sentences.english: Mineral resources in the Paleo-Asia domain are extremely abundant.
sentences.chinese: 古亚洲成矿域矿产资源十分丰富。

sentences.english: Our country is abundant in minerals.
The mineral resource utilization system which is a non-linear system is studied in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 本文研究了矿产资源利用这一非线性系统。
瓦房店矿产资源十分丰富。

sentences.english: Major types, characteristics and metallogeneses of gold deposits in southwest Tianshan Mountains, Xinjiang;
sentences.chinese: 西南天山是我国重要金和有色金属矿产远景区。

definition: to extract (ore or other resource from a mine)/to exploit/to mine
remaining quantity/reserves (of natural resources, oil etc)
